nodes.bodyText:
What do you mean with 'to avoid losing any useful configuration warnings'
Also maybe add : warnings.suppress.transaction.{NameOfTheAdapter}=true, as just specifying the property isn't enough.

transaction suppression key suppresses 3 different warnings all related to transactions. It is possible that a programmer sets the property to true then do some modification in the configuration and forget to set it to false and lose some of the config warnings.

Ah I understand what you mean. I think it's best to add an attribute to the enums where you can specify if it works on global or on adapter level. In the case of warnings.suppress.transaction, warnings.suppress.integrityCheck and warnings.suppress.sqlInjections you never want to set this on a global level (as it's too dangerous like you mentioned). A developer must specifically suppress a warning for a given adapter, so future (new) adapters will get these warnings again.
Maybe it's time for this to become an Enum
Shouldn't you put this in the MqttFacade? It already has a configure, just no IConfigurable interface
This class already has a configure method, If you add the IConfigurable interface here you don't have to add it on it's children.
Please use @Getter annotation instead
Please use @Getter annotation instead
Unnecessary change, please remove file from PR
Unnecessary change, please remove file from PR
Please use @Getter annotation instead
In this case this has to be 'Name of the listener or sender'
Please use @Getter annotation
Please let this class extend SenderBase, and inherit name and classloader from that class

+package nl.nn.adapterframework.configuration;
+
+import lombok.Getter;
+
+/**
+ * Enumeration class for suppressing configuration warnings.
+ * 
+ * @author alisihab
+ *
+ */
+public enum SuppressKeys {
+
+	SQL_INJECTION_SUPPRESS_KEY("warnings.suppress.sqlInjections"),
+	DEPRECATION_SUPPRESS_KEY("warnings.suppress.deprecated"),
+	DEFAULT_VALUE_SUPPRESS_KEY("warnings.suppress.defaultvalue"),
+	TRANSACTION_SUPPRESS_KEY("warnings.suppress.transaction"),
+	INTEGRITY_CHECK_SUPPRESS_KEY("warnings.suppress.integrityCheck");
+
+	private @Getter String key;
+

nodes.bodyText: A configuration should not add a Global Warning, only configuration warnings. You're also displaying the objectname twice, see getObjectName(currObj, name).
This should be in the log? not in the warning
should be false

nodes.bodyText:
Now msg is logged twice: first without the hint in addGlobalWarning(), then here with the hint.
This should not happen. The message should be logged only once, (with or without hint, depending on log.isInfoEnabled())

Now msg is logged twice: first without the hint in add(), then here with the hint.
This should not happen. The message should be logged only once, (with or without hint, depending on log.isInfoEnabled())
When it extends SenderBase, it is not necessary to explicitly implement ISender, that comes with SenderBase
